attributes.action: Tackle the outrageous cost of transportation in Britain
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It costs more to travel in the UK than anywhere else in Europe thanks to sky high fuel duty, ever increasing rail fares and a creaking infrastructure which has been starved of investment since the 1960s.

I therefore petition the government to recognise that Britain's commuters do not travel for pleasure, but to places of work.  Moreover I believe that in order for the "green" initiative to be taken seriously, cheap and efficient public transport needs to be urgently provided as a viable alternative to the controversial and hugely unpopular "road pricing scheme".

Failure to provide cheap and efficient alternatives will be viewed by the British taxpayer as a cynical exercise in revenue extraction from the ever burdened motoring public.
